KH.content: in On the Social Contract, a form of fiction, war serves to throw light on limits of social contract [and Rousseau's’ fabulous text as well]
KH.linkedContent: in On the Social Contract, a form of fiction, war serves to throw light on limits of social contract [and Rousseau's’ fabulous text as well]

GOD.content: plea for forgiveness in inheritance of God’s retraction; God’s retraction, a double coming-back, covenant only sealed through repetition [Noah is twice forgiven], God goes back on himself; dissymmetrical contract of Covenant supposes double trait of this retreat (re-trait) (Entzug)
GOD.linkedContent: plea for forgiveness in inheritance of God’s retraction; God’s retraction, a double coming-back, covenant only sealed through repetition [Noah is twice forgiven], God goes back on himself; dissymmetrical contract of Covenant supposes double trait of this retreat (re-trait) (Entzug)

GT.content: beggar as profound index of socius, at foundation of social contract
GT.linkedContent: beggar as profound index of socius, at foundation of social contract

MC.content: each explanatory context gives a performative of convention and a contract that guarantees new performatives
MC.linkedContent: each explanatory context gives a performative of convention and a contract that guarantees new performatives

FL.content: justice is infinite because irreducible, irreducible because owed to the other before any contract, parce qu’elle est venue (because it has come, because it is a coming)
FL.linkedContent: justice is infinite because irreducible, irreducible because owed to the other before any contract, parce qu’elle est venue (because it has come, because it is a coming)

FWT.content: heritage of circumcision precedes speech, oath, contract

TB.content: at edge of the language, from this edge to the other of proper name: debt contracts the trait (to-be-translated from one language to the other) of relation of living subject to his name
TB.linkedContent: at edge of the language, from this edge to the other of proper name: debt contracts the trait (to-be-translated from one language to the other) of relation of living subject to his name

TB.content: to be able to translate as contract > transcendental possibility of all contracts (absolute contract): origin of languages before language
TB.linkedContent: to be able to translate as contract > transcendental possibility of all contracts (absolute contract): origin of languages before language

TB.content: for Derrida, “translation contract” is hymen or marriage contract (a seminar) > w/ promise to produce a child whose seed will give rise to history/growth
TB.linkedContent: for Derrida, “translation contract” is hymen or marriage contract (a seminar) > w/ promise to produce a child whose seed will give rise to history/growth

TB.content: Benjamin says as much, that in translation the original will enlarge itself > Derrida adds: this child can speak on its own, something other than a product subjected to law of reproduction > sacred and being-to-be-translated produce each other at edge of same limit
TB.linkedContent: Benjamin says as much, that in translation the original will enlarge itself > Derrida adds: this child can speak on its own, something other than a product subjected to law of reproduction > sacred and being-to-be-translated produce each other at edge of same limit

TB.content: promise of reconciliation (even if unfulfillable) is a rare & notable event: kingdom is never reached, is untouchable > but the commitment takes place, bequeaths its record
TB.linkedContent: promise of reconciliation (even if unfulfillable) is a rare & notable event: kingdom is never reached, is untouchable > but the commitment takes place, bequeaths its record

DPi.content: DP as origin of social contract, state, any community
DPi.linkedContent: DP as origin of social contract, state, any community

DPi.content: re: Universal Declaration of Human Rights, writing down laws that have no juridical force behind them, not a binding obligation [contract]
DPi.linkedContent: re: Universal Declaration of Human Rights, writing down laws that have no juridical force behind them, not a binding obligation [contract]

DPi.content: Nietzsche’s arche-genealogical question is the question of origin of law, of penal law as origin of calculation, rule of calculation > whence comes equivalence btwn injury/pain
DPi.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s arche-genealogical question is the question of origin of law, of penal law as origin of calculation, rule of calculation > whence comes equivalence btwn injury/pain

DPi.content: Nietzsche’s very legitimate question re: equivalence btwn injury/pain, unbelievable jus talionis > it is because we believe, it is because we grant it credit, that we can believe in this equivalence > thus origin of penal law is commercial law: what has us believe in equivalence btwn crime/punishment is belief itself > fiduciary phenomenon of credit or faith
DPi.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s very legitimate question re: equivalence btwn injury/pain, unbelievable jus talionis > it is because we believe, it is because we grant it credit, that we can believe in this equivalence > thus origin of penal law is commercial law: what has us believe in equivalence btwn crime/punishment is belief itself > fiduciary phenomenon of credit or faith

REST.content: [re: Shapiro/Heidegger correspondence] reciprocal legitimation, effects of a common code, mutual desire for truth: the 2 parts of the pair (identity & difference, total identity in concept or formal semantics, difference and non-overlap in directionality of traits)
REST.linkedContent: [re: Shapiro/Heidegger correspondence] reciprocal legitimation, effects of a common code, mutual desire for truth: the 2 parts of the pair (identity & difference, total identity in concept or formal semantics, difference and non-overlap in directionality of traits)

REST.content: if there is a pair > a contract is possible, can look for subject, can hope (symbol of the symbolon)
REST.linkedContent: if there is a pair > a contract is possible, can look for subject, can hope (symbol of the symbolon)

REST.content: whose shoes (whose feet) (the subject of reattachment): the capital subject of this contract [btwn Shapiro & Heidegger], they each have one piece of symbolon, share common interest, coded commitment
REST.linkedContent: whose shoes (whose feet) (the subject of reattachment): the capital subject of this contract [btwn Shapiro & Heidegger], they each have one piece of symbolon, share common interest, coded commitment

REST.content: no symbolic contract in case of double that does not form a pair > not 1 (même) chose in 2, but a 2 in identity
REST.linkedContent: no symbolic contract in case of double that does not form a pair > not 1 (même) chose in 2, but a 2 in identity

REST.content: a contract of “impulsive or precritical naïveté” [all contracts?]
REST.linkedContent: a contract of “impulsive or precritical naïveté” [all contracts?]

REST.content: Heidegger & Shapiro bound themselves together to law of normal usage, the pair, ligatured worrying dismemberment in order to limit it: pair inhibits “fetishizing” movement, represses diabolical (i.e. a double, duplicity, w/out a pair)—pair rivets (rive) things to “normal” use
REST.linkedContent: Heidegger & Shapiro bound themselves together to law of normal usage, the pair, ligatured worrying dismemberment in order to limit it: pair inhibits “fetishizing” movement, represses diabolical (i.e. a double, duplicity, w/out a pair)—pair rivets (rive) things to “normal” use

PIO.content: invention (new, original, unique) breaks w/ rhetoric of modesty (convention, etiquette, contract) > w/ all conditions of social interaction
PIO.linkedContent: invention (new, original, unique) breaks w/ rhetoric of modesty (convention, etiquette, contract) > w/ all conditions of social interaction

PIO.content: invention always presupposes some illegality, a breaking of the contract
PIO.linkedContent: invention always presupposes some illegality, a breaking of the contract

RM.content: Heidegger’s nontautological fashion (like Sprache, Ereignis): trait treats or treats itself, traces the trait, retraces or re-treats the withdrawal > a strange contract that doesn’t precede, for once, its own signature (sa propre signature), and therefore carries it off (et donc l’emporte)
RM.linkedContent: Heidegger’s nontautological fashion (like Sprache, Ereignis): trait treats or treats itself, traces the trait, retraces or re-treats the withdrawal > a strange contract that doesn’t precede, for once, its own signature (sa propre signature), and therefore carries it off (et donc l’emporte)

RM.content: from “Origin of the Work of Art,” Zug zum Werk (attraction toward the work), work as sumballein, allegoreuein, nonwithdrawal of truth as truth, Un-verborgenheit > truth as originary combat (Urstreit) > a combat that’s an attraction of reciprocal belonging, a Grundriss
RM.linkedContent: from “Origin of the Work of Art,” Zug zum Werk (attraction toward the work), work as sumballein, allegoreuein, nonwithdrawal of truth as truth, Un-verborgenheit > truth as originary combat (Urstreit) > a combat that’s an attraction of reciprocal belonging, a Grundriss

HLP.content: Kant: veracity a formal duty (formale Pflicht)
for Kant, veracity as a formal condition of right, social contract, not ethical but meta-juridical, not historical: “[a lie] necessarily does harm to humanity in general”
HLP.linkedContent: for Kant, veracity as a formal condition of right, social contract, not ethical but meta-juridical, not historical: “[a lie] necessarily does harm to humanity in general”

PJP.content: faux témoignage, contrefaçon; perhaps I have already lied by promising veracity (veracity not truth) > Western social contract capitalizes this perhaps in the act of perjury
PJP.linkedContent: faux témoignage, contrefaçon; perhaps I have already lied by promising veracity (veracity not truth) > Western social contract capitalizes this perhaps in the act of perjury

PJP.content: acolyte, anacolytic, anakolouthia, analytic figure: as much an analyst as a breach, interruption> a rupture in a set (contract), be it that of friendship, community, being-together
PJP.linkedContent: acolyte, anacolytic, anakolouthia, analytic figure: as much an analyst as a breach, interruption> a rupture in a set (contract), be it that of friendship, community, being-together

PPT.content: event makes a contract w/ itself at instant when singularity of trait divides, in order to link itself to play, chance & economy of language > set economy going by exposing it to chance
PPT.linkedContent: event makes a contract w/ itself at instant when singularity of trait divides, in order to link itself to play, chance & economy of language > set economy going by exposing it to chance

PPT.content: the “interest,” the revenue of the surplus value, remains untranslatable in idiom’s economic performance, in ellipses of its trait, the word by word or trait for trait in which it contracts
PPT.linkedContent: the “interest,” the revenue of the surplus value, remains untranslatable in idiom’s economic performance, in ellipses of its trait, the word by word or trait for trait in which it contracts

C.content: breakable, limping hyphen: not only an emblem, a coat of arms, but the symbol > acc. symballein, brings together pieces of a body divided in contract, pact, alliance [symballistic]
C.linkedContent: breakable, limping hyphen: not only an emblem, a coat of arms, but the symbol > acc. symballein, brings together pieces of a body divided in contract, pact, alliance [symballistic]

LI.content: very strong probability of intelligibility of a text is result of stabilized solidity of numerous contracts; minimal consensus > community requires this (discusses this)
LI.linkedContent: very strong probability of intelligibility of a text is result of stabilized solidity of numerous contracts; minimal consensus > community requires this (discusses this)

TN.content: for Nancy, [re: “extreme contraction” that turns opening into auto-affection] “I” owes as much to the contract, to gathered stroke or trait of this contraction, as to the opening itself (what’s called a mouth) > a gathering in an interruption (“syncope,” “convulsion,” “spasm”), cut that opens & shuts the mouth
TN.linkedContent: for Nancy, [re: “extreme contraction” that turns opening into auto-affection] “I” owes as much to the contract, to gathered stroke or trait of this contraction, as to the opening itself (what’s called a mouth) > a gathering in an interruption (“syncope,” “convulsion,” “spasm”), cut that opens & shuts the mouth

BSi.content: political contract, a prosthesis, nomos as thesis (opposed to physis), convention, positing
BSi.linkedContent: political contract, a prosthesis, nomos as thesis (opposed to physis), convention, positing

BSi.content: thus provisional, historical, always deconstructible > declared immortal because not
BSi.linkedContent: thus provisional, historical, always deconstructible > declared immortal because not

OG.content: acc. Rousseau, return to inalienable immediacy of self-possession (jouissance de soi), unrepresentable sovereignty—the end of written law > there is a social contract before writing, but always threatened by letter
OG.linkedContent: acc. Rousseau, return to inalienable immediacy of self-possession (jouissance de soi), unrepresentable sovereignty—the end of written law > there is a social contract before writing, but always threatened by letter

OG.content: for Rousseau, writing is origin of inequality
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, writing is origin of inequality

OG.content: Rousseau’s bonne fête > theater w/out representation, nothing to see since visibility entame la voix vivante; bonne fête: general will, sovereignty of social contract [signifier, la mort de la fête]
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau’s bonne fête > theater w/out representation, nothing to see since visibility entame la voix vivante; bonne fête: general will, sovereignty of social contract [signifier, la mort de la fête]

SPEC.content: greatest pleasure, play w/ the dummy (le mort), [Ernst, Freud] speaks to himself telephonically, make himself re-, acc. law of PP: signing, contracting w/ himself
SPEC.linkedContent: greatest pleasure, play w/ the dummy (le mort), [Ernst, Freud] speaks to himself telephonically, make himself re-, acc. law of PP: signing, contracting w/ himself

FV.content: [in Purloined Letter] Queen wishes to play on 2 contracts [must be read elsewhere?]: Queen’s desire to retain (garder) or refind the letter doubles her pact w/ the King
FV.linkedContent: [in Purloined Letter] Queen wishes to play on 2 contracts [must be read elsewhere?]: Queen’s desire to retain (garder) or refind the letter doubles her pact w/ the King

FV.content: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]
FV.linkedContent: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]

FV.content: the 2 truths: adequation (original contract: acquitting of debt), unveiling (lack on basis of which contract contracts in order to reappropriate what’s been detached)
FV.linkedContent: the 2 truths: adequation (original contract: acquitting of debt), unveiling (lack on basis of which contract contracts in order to reappropriate what’s been detached)

FV.content: for Lacan, analyst links truth to power of speech: power of communication as a contract btwn 2 present things
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, analyst links truth to power of speech: power of communication as a contract btwn 2 present things
